text: Is there an emacs org-mode workflow for publishing with Franklin?

elements.text: Is there an emacs org-mode workflow for publishing with Franklin?

text: Or, e.g., do I have to make my own pipeline that exports first to markdown and then to franklin

elements.text: Or, e.g., do I have to make my own pipeline that exports first to markdown and then to franklin

text:
no emacs mode (I'm not even able to open and close a file on emacs without having to kill my terminal along the way :sweat_smile: I prefer neovim but that's for another discussion).

I'm not sure I understand your second question?

elements.text: no emacs mode (I'm not even able to open and close a file on emacs without having to kill my terminal along the way

I prefer neovim but that's for another discussion).

I'm not sure I understand your second question?

text: org-mode is an alternative markup from markdown. there are convenient programs for publishing “wiki”s of connected files from org-mode by exporting from emacs to html, markdown, or other pipelines that can hook into static site generators like Jekyll or Hugo.

root.text: Is there an emacs org-mode workflow for publishing with Franklin?

elements.text: Is there an emacs org-mode workflow for publishing with Franklin?

org-mode is an alternative markup from markdown. there are convenient programs for publishing “wiki”s of connected files from org-mode by exporting from emacs to html, markdown, or other pipelines that can hook into static site generators like Jekyll or Hugo.

text: I learned something, thanks! so yes it looks like org mode has this markdown export and that would be what Franklin could start with
